speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: To the Navajo, the earth and its creatures have great influence over our existence. The stories passed from generation to generation help us to understand the reason for our tears of sadness and our tears of joy. Animals like the bear, the spider and the coyote are powerful symbols to our people. When the F.B.I. man Mulder was cured by the holy people, we were reminded of the story of the Gila monster, who symbolizes the healing powers of the medicine man. In this myth, the Gila monster restores a man by taking all his parts and putting them back together. His blood is gathered by ants, his eyes and ears by sun, his mind by Talking God and Pollen Boy. Then lightning and thunder bring the man back to life. At the end of the ceremony, when the F.B.I. man had been healed, we heard the news from other Native Americans in the northern plains that a great event had taken place. Like the Navajo, these people have their own stories and myths. One of these stories tells of the white buffalo woman who came down from the heavens and taught the Indians how to lead virtuous lives and how to pray to the creator. She told the people she would return one day, then she turned into a white buffalo and ascended into the clouds, never to be seen again. But on this day, when the holy people had given the F.B.I. man a miracle, a white buffalo was born and every Native American knew, whether he believed the story or not, that this was a powerful omen and that great changes were coming.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've got the digital tape.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're lying.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've got it in my pocket. I took it out of Mulder's desk. Drop your weapon! Put it down, Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No way.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I said put it down!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I said no! You're setting me up!

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm trying to help you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then put your weapon down and sit down.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Not a chance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You said you weren't here to kill me, Skinner, now prove it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I didn't come here to have a gun shoved in my face either.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Damn it, Skinner!

speaker: MULDER
line: Drop your weapon! I said...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Back off!

speaker: MULDER
line: I said put it down!

speaker: SKINNER
line: What the hell is this? What are you pulling here?

speaker: MULDER
line: You okay, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get his gun. Give her the gun. Give it to her!

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now, I want an explanation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was warned that somebody would kill me... someone I trusted.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm going to reach into my coat pocket and end this charade... all right? I assume you both know what this is? Now, I want an explanation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your cigarette-smoking friend killed my father for that tape, and then he killed me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was a dead man. Now, I'm back.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What is on this tape?

speaker: MULDER
line: Defense department files that weren't supposed to exist. The truth about our government's involvement in a global conspiracy of silence about the existence of extraterrestrial life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Give me the tape.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Uh-uh, this tape stays with me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Give her the tape.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If what you say is true, the information on this tape is valuable enough to kill for. Then it's the only leverage we've got to bring these men to justice. It's not going to do us any good if it falls back into their hands!

speaker: MULDER
line: Then you better make sure it doesn't. Come on, Scully, let's go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: MULDER
line: There are truths out there that aren't on that tape.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I am...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, whatever you're going to say...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I went to your father's funeral. I told your mother that you were going to be okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did you know?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just knew.

speaker: MAN
line: If you'd wait there, sir...

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Uh, my daughter was brought here. I'm trying to find her.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Okay, all right, what's her name?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Scully. Dana Scully.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Melissa Scully?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: No, no... that's her sister.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Well, we just had a Melissa Scully in surgery with a cranial gunshot wound.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Missy? It's Mom.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We took drastic precautionary measures due to the nature of the head wound. We've induced coma to try and relieve the trauma on the brain.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Is she going to be okay?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We've done everything we can right now. We'll being monitoring her around the clock. Nurse, why don't we get Mrs. Scully a comfortable chair?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's my father on the left there.

speaker: BYERS
line: This was taken when?

speaker: MULDER
line: About 1973.

speaker: BYERS
line: Amazing. Langly, take a look.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you recognize any of these men?

speaker: BYERS
line: Are you familiar with a post-World War II project known as Operation Paper Clip?

speaker: MULDER
line: Our deal with the devil. The U.S. government provided safe haven for certain Nazi war criminals in exchange for their scientific knowledge.

speaker: LANGLY
line: I know who this man is. Victor Klemper.

speaker: BYERS
line: The man standing next to your father is one of those criminals, though not the most famous of the bunch. Wernher von Braun, designer of the V-2 rockets that leveled London, may be the most notorious, but Victor Klemper certainly takes the prize for the most... evil Nazi to escape the Nuremburg trials.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did he do?

speaker: LANGLY
line: He experimented on the Jews... drowned them, suffocated them, put them in pressure chambers. All in the name of science.

speaker: BYERS
line: Together with Von Braun, Klemper helped us win the space race. Using his scientific data on the effects of high-altitude flying, we were able to put astronauts on the moon before the Soviets.

speaker: LANGLY
line: One giant step for mankind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What would he be doing in a photo with your father?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. Do you recognize anybody else in the photograph?

speaker: BYERS
line: No. Operation Paper Clip was supposed to have been scrapped in the 1950s but if this is 1973...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Whatever happened to Klemper?

speaker: LANGLY
line: He's still here, living very well at the expense of the American taxpayer.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Unbelieveable! We thought you were history.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're going to have to wait a little longer for my video collection, Frohike.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Where were you? We were looking all over.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Down at D.C. general, I was scanning the police frequency when I heard the report of a shooting. Agent Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What, what is it?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Your sister's in critical condition.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully... Scully, wait. Scully! Scully, wait! Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to go there, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can't go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That bullet was meant for me.

speaker: MULDER
line: If they're trying to kill you, that's the first place they're going to look.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Those bastards...

speaker: MULDER
line: We're going to call someone I think can help. It's the only thing you can do for her right now is try to crucify them.

speaker: 46TH STREET, NEW YORK CITY; 7
line: 09 AM

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: This is a serious mistake. An innocent woman has been shot.

speaker: 2ND ELDER
line: Can this be traced?

speaker: 3RD ELDER
line: This is your man.

speaker: CSM
line: There was a mistake. It will be rectified.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: By whom? By whom will this be rectified? Your ridiculously ineffectual assassins?

speaker: CSM
line: These men are professionals.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: This is not a profession for men who make mistakes. My God, you presume to make us believe you can simply fix it with enough bullets?

speaker: CSM
line: No.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: This woman... Scully... I know she believes her partner is still alive.

speaker: CSM
line: Mulder's dead. I took care of it myself.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: And the computer tape containing the stolen files you tell us was recovered... you can show it to us?

speaker: CSM
line: I wasn't aware that my honesty was in question or doubt.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: You have the tape?

speaker: CSM
line: Of course I have it.

speaker: 2ND ELDER
line: I think I'd like to see it.

speaker: 3RD ELDER
line: So would I.

speaker: CSM
line: I have vouchsafed it for reasons of security. I'll have it here for you tomorrow... by which time this whole matter will have been cleared up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Victor Klemper?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER
line: My name is Fox Mulder, this is Dana Scully.

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: Your name is Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. I think you knew my father.

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: What's this about?

speaker: MULDER
line: When you came to this country, you did some work for our government.

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: I'm an old man now. History bores me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because it escaped you or because you escaped it?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: Freud, Salk, Crick, Watson... these will be the names they celebrate at the end of the millenium. Great scientists. And Klemper? He will be remembered only as a butcher.

speaker: SCULLY
line: History may be the only justice you'll ever know.

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: Do you know my work? Do you know what we accomplished?

speaker: SCULLY
line: As a Nazi or for the blood money we paid you?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: We were young men caught in a fervor but our experiments changed the world.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For a lot of innocent Jews.

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: Progress demands sacrifice, and I... I have confronted my demons. And soon I will die too.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like my father. They killed him and I believe you know why.

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: I believe they would kill anyone if it is in the best interest of the work.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what is this "work" that my father was involved in?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: I have no answer for you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, you knew him! Was he a murderer too?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: There are some things you don't have to know.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I need to know! I need to know the truth! Isn't that what you want? For the truth to be known?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: Do you know the formula of Napier's constant?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, why?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: The photo was taken at the Strughold Mining Company in West Virginia and that is all I will tell you. The rest you can find out yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go, Scully.

speaker: AIDE
line: Hello?

speaker: AIDE
line: Yes, one moment. It's for you, sir.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Yes?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: It's Klemper.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Victor...

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: How are you, old friend? It's been far too many years.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: What is it, Victor?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: Oh, I was just paid a visit by the son of one of our old colleagues.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: What did you tell him, Victor?

speaker: VICTOR KLEMPER
line: I told him that you were the most venal man I've ever met. Beyond that, I told him nothing.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Mulder is alive.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: Then I think it's time we call our friends who will handle this matter more satisfactorily.

speaker: NURSE
line: Are you expecting any visitors?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Oh, is it Dana? Is Dana here?

speaker: NURSE
line: No, it's a man. He says he was asked to come here.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: My name is Albert Hosteen. I was asked to come here and help with your daughter.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: There must be some mistake.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: Is your daughter the F.B.I. woman?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Dana?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: Yes. She's very sorry she can't come here to comfort you.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: You know where she is? Is she okay?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: Yes, I believe so. She is weak.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: She's getting better. She has the best doctors, they're watching her around the clock.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: If it's all right, I would like to pray over her here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think your father would have been doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. He never came home wearing a miner's cap.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, take a look at this. What do you think?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd like to try door number one, Monty. I'm trying two-seven-eight-two-eight, it's not working.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not working here either.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sure that's the right number?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Positive. Napier's constant is the basis of all natural logarithms.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think with a crowbar and a small nuclear device, I might be able to get through one of these things.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... No, wait, hang on a second. Whatever we find in here... I don't think you've had time to process everything that you've been through.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm okay, Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You weren't even able to go to your father's funeral and if something in here were to cast doubt on the kind of man he was... I, I just know how it would affect me.

speaker: CSM
line: You called me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, I did.

speaker: CSM
line: About?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I may have located the digital tape that you're looking for.

speaker: CSM
line: You may have located it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, although there's a great chance it may fall into the hands of people who want to use it for purposes not your own.

speaker: CSM
line: You want to work a deal? Is that what this is? Let me tell you something. I don't work deals.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I just thought you should know of certain potentialities.

speaker: CSM
line: Do you have the tape?

speaker: SKINNER
line: As I said, I may have located it.

speaker: CSM
line: Do you have the damn tape?!

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll know more when we next meet.

speaker: CSM
line: I do not negotiate. Do you understand?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: CSM
line: I don't think you do. I don't think you understand at all.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I'm quite aware of your policies in those regards.

speaker: CSM
line: Then I hope your next course of action will be more... cautious and informed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, look at this. It looks like their storing records.

speaker: MULDER
line: Of what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Of medical files, by the look of it. Got names... alphabetized.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lots of files.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lots and lots of files.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's in these files?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Standard medical forms. These are birth certificates, small pox vaccination certificate and then there's this.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's an old tissue collection cassette, the new ones are plastic.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do all these files contain the same materials?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, exactly.

speaker: MULDER
line: What year was this person born?

speaker: SCULLY
line: 1955. All of these files are 1955.

speaker: MULDER
line: What year were you born?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go find 1964.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're looking for a file on me?

speaker: MULDER
line: "Dana Katherine Scully."

speaker: SCULLY
line: What? That's a recent tissue sample. What the hell is going on here, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's your sister's file.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: "SUBJECT NAME
line: MULDER, Samantha Ann

speaker: BIRTH DATE
line: 11/21/65 ID 378671") Take a look at this, Scully.

speaker: "SUBJECT NAME
line: MULDER, Fox William

speaker: BIRTH DATE
line: 10/13/61 ID 292544") This file was originally mine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait here, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, where are you going? Mulder? Mulder!

speaker: MAN #1
line: Come on, let's go!

speaker: MAN #2
line: There!

speaker: MAN #3
line: Find the woman too.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I'm down here!

speaker: MULDER
line: You okay, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I heard gunshots.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been looking for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to you?

speaker: MULDER
line: They got a small army outside. I think they got us trapped.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think there's a way out, down here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This place isn't even on the map. How'd you get here?

speaker: MULDER
line: You'd be surprised what's not on the map in this country and what our government will do to keep it that way.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How's that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Last night, we were chased by some kind of hit squad driving what looked an awful lot like C.I.A. fleet sedans.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, I may be able to negotiate a deal that would guarantee your safety.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of deal?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll turn over the digital tape in return for your reinstatement...

speaker: MULDER
line: No, sir. I need that tape. I need those files.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm talking about a way to save your lives.

speaker: MULDER
line: And I'm talking about an elaborate conspiracy against the American public. Do you know what we found last night?

speaker: SKINNER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: An extremely elaborate filing system of medical records.

speaker: MULDER
line: Locked inside a mountain vault.

speaker: SKINNER
line: For the purpose of?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. But the answer's got to be on that tape, in those files.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is that answer worth your lives?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's obviously worth killing us for.

speaker: SKINNER
line: In your wildest dreams, what do you possibly hope to find, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why they killed my father... and what happened to my sister... and what they did to Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think we should let him make the deal, Mulder. Look... those answers mean nothing if we're going to be hunted down like animals. We are operating so far outside of the law right now, we've given up on the very notion of justice. We've turned ourselves into outsiders. We have lost our access and our protection.

speaker: MULDER
line: What makes you think there's any such thing as justice, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then what good are those answers to anybody but you, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: What we found last night...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I want exactly what you want. But I need to see my sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: I suppose you already tried to make a backup of the tape.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Whoever downloaded those files put a copy protector on them. I couldn't get a hard copy to print either.

speaker: MULDER
line: What makes you think they'll even honor this deal?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Because, if they don't... I'll go state's evidence and testify... or they'll have to kill me too.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's up to you, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I told Skinner to make the deal. But not to hand over the tape until you agree to it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry about your sister, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just need to know if she's going to be okay.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: For two days, I had prayed for the F.B.I. woman's sister. Her doctor said she was getting better and her mother, who would not leave her bedside, was able to sleep. But word had come from my brothers in the north that did not give me hope. The white buffalo calf had survived, but after a day, it would no longer drink its mother's milk. On the third day, the mother buffalo laid down in her stall and would not get up. They said the men could do nothing for her. That night, she died. My father taught me when I was a boy that this is how life is. That for something to live, another thing must often be sacrificed. This was my fear now for the young woman.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm here to see Melissa Scully. My name is Walter Skinner. I'm an assistant director at the F.B.I. I'm very sorry about your daughter. Dana asked me to come here to deliver a message.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: You've been in contact with her?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Well, I want to know where she is and if she's okay.

speaker: SKINNER
line: She's okay, but she's in a very serious situation which prevents her from being here.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: What kind of situation?

speaker: SKINNER
line: One that we hope to reverse so that Dana can come back to work.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: That man you just saw, he's been very curious about this room.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who are you?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: My name is Albert Hosteen. I was asked to come here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: All right, Albert. Do not leave this room. Do you understand?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: Yes.

speaker: 2ND MAN
line: I could use a beer. Do you want anything?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: No.

speaker: 2ND MAN
line: You sure?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah.

speaker: AT THE CAR CLOCK AS IT BLINKS 12
line: 00. His face goes blank in realization and he runs out of the car as fast as he can. The car literally shoots a fireball into the air as it explodes, knocking Krycek off his feet from twenty yards. He looks back briefly and keeps running as the car continues to burn. Krycek's ex-cohorts watch him run, knowing that they failed their mission.)

speaker: MULDER
line: Mister Klemper? Mister Klemper?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Hello again, young lady.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's Victor Klemper?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Oh, poor Klemper. They found him yesterday, here among his flowers. Apparently, his heart had given out.

speaker: MULDER
line: You killed him, didn't you? You're one of the men in this photo. You knew my father.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Yes. Since we were young men.

speaker: MULDER
line: You were involved in this project. You know why the medical data was being collected.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Yes, I do, indeed. In 1947, a spacecraft was reportedly recovered in New Mexico. No doubt you know of this and of the reported recovery of a body at the site. These incidents not only coincided with the end of World War II, but an ignominious project which brought Nazi scientists and war criminals to this country to exploit their knowledge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Operation Paper Clip.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Yes, you know of it already. And you must also know the work of Doctor Joseph Mengele, the Nazi angel of death.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mengele thought that he could produce a super-race through genetic engineering.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: As did many of his colleagues at the Institute of Hereditary Biology and Racial Hygiene.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like Victor Klemper?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Poor Victor. He loved his orchids. Did you know that he was able to create some of the most beautiful hybrids?

speaker: MULDER
line: Klemper was trying to create an alien-human hybrid. That's what I saw in the boxcar. He was using human test subjects.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, wait.

speaker: MULDER
line: My father was involved in this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The technology wasn't there, Mulder. DNA wasn't even identified until 1944. This is all a lie.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: When your father realized what the medical data was being used for, he objected strenuously.

speaker: MULDER
line: He collected those files?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: With the threat of nuclear holocaust in the 1950s, the government instructed men like your father to gather genetic data on the general populous for the purpose of post-apocalyptic identification.

speaker: MULDER
line: The vaccination records. They took tissue from everyone who received a small pox inoculation.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Hundreds of millions of Americans.

speaker: MULDER
line: So that Victor Klemper had access to a DNA database of nearly everyone who was born since 1950.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this man is telling you everything that you want to hear but it's a fabrication, it is pure science fiction. There were no experiments with aliens.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Why would I lie to you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like you said before, to protect yourself and the continuation of the Nazi agenda... human tests.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why was your file there, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: There were current records on file.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, but records of what, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Of abductions! Of abductees. They took my sister. Why?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: They took her as insurance because your father threatened to expose the project.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why her? Why not me?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: It's not for me to say but your life in danger now too. You also threaten to expose the project. You have become your father.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why are you telling me this?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: It's what you want to know... isn't it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there more?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: More than you'll ever know.

speaker: AIDE
line: Yes?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Can I talk to him?

speaker: AIDE
line: Yes, he's just arrived. One moment, please. You have a call, sir.

speaker: CSM
line: Thank you. Hello?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I'm alive. Isn't that a surprise?

speaker: CSM
line: Yes, good, good, good. Uh, where are you?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Somewhere that you will never find me, you double-crossing son of a bitch.

speaker: CSM
line: Are you sure?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I'm sure of this... if I so much as feel your presence, I'm going to make you a very, very famous man. You understand?

speaker: CSM
line: Yes, thank you. I'm going to report that to the group. I've just received confirmation that the digital tape containing the stolen files was destroyed in the carbomb explosion, which killed Agent Scully's would-be assassin.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: What about Mulder and Scully?

speaker: CSM
line: I have a meeting with the F.B.I., they, uh... they want to make a deal.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: For what?

speaker: CSM
line: For nothing. There'll be no deal. There's no deal to make.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Fox?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: What time is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's after two.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: What, did you drive up here? Why didn't you call?

speaker: MULDER
line: I needed to see you in person. I need to ask you something. I need to ask you about something that happened a long time ago.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Oh, Fox... I don't remember anything, I told you before.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mom, listen to me. When Samantha... before she was gone, did Dad ever ask you if you had a favorite? Did he ever ask you that?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Fox, please...

speaker: MULDER
line: Mom, did he ever ask you to make a choice?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Don't do this...

speaker: MULDER
line: Mom, listen to me! I need to know! Did he make you make a choice?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: No. I couldn't choose. It was your father's choice and I hated him for it. Even in his grave, I hate him still.

speaker: CSM
line: Now, you wanted to see me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I have the tape you've been looking for.

speaker: CSM
line: Really?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm prepared to hand it over or destroy it in exchange for Mulder and Scully's safety and for their reinstatement here.

speaker: CSM
line: What did I tell you, Mister Skinner? I don't negotiate. Especially not with punks like you who think they can bluff me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Bluff you?

speaker: CSM
line: You haven't got any tape. You haven't got any deal. You can't play poker if you don't have any cards, Mister Skinner. You ever wonder what it would be like to, uh... die in a plane crash? Of botulism? Even a heart attack's not uncommon for a man your age. You think I'm bluffing?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not finished yet. Albert?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: Yat a valgala.

speaker: CSM
line: What is this?

speaker: SKINNER
line: This is where you pucker up and kiss my ass.

speaker: CSM
line: Now, listen, you...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Now, you listen to me, you son of a bitch! This man's name is Albert Hosteen. You should remember that. Because if Agents Mulder and Scully come down with so much as a case of the flu, Albert is prepared to recite, chapter and verse, file for file, everything on your precious tape.

speaker: CSM
line: It's a nice try, Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm sure you're thinking Albert is an old man and there are plenty of ways you might kill him too. Which is why, in the ancient oral tradition of his people, he's told twenty other men the information on those files. So unless you kill every Navajo living in four states... that information is available with a simple phone call. Welcome to the wonderful world of high technology.

speaker: CSM
line: You're bluffing.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Am I?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It happened three hours ago. She went into surgery and, uh... the damage to her brain was worse than they had hoped. Her blood pressure started to rise and, uh... she slipped away. She died for me and I tried to tell her I was sorry but I don't think she'll ever really know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, she knows. Melissa knows.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You were right. There is no justice.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think this is about justice, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then what is it about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think it's about something we have no personal choice in. I think it's about fate. Skinner told me that he talked to you, that you were insistent about coming back to work. Now, if Melissa's death is...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need something to put my back up against.

speaker: MULDER
line: I feel the same way. We've both lost so much... but I believe that what we're looking for is in the X-Files. I'm more certain than ever that the truth is in there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've heard the truth, Mulder. Now what I want are the answers.
